org.vaadin.addons.beantuplecontainer
Class BeanTupleQueryView

java.lang.Object
  org.vaadin.addons.beantuplecontainer.BeanTupleQueryView
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.vaadin.data.Property.ValueChangeListener, Serializable, KeyManager, org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.QueryView
Direct Known Subclasses:
CriteriaQueryView
public class BeanTupleQueryView
extends Object
implements org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.QueryView, com.vaadin.data.Property.ValueChangeListener, KeyManager

Wrapper around the LazyQueryView. For some reason, LazyQueryView was defined as final.

Author:
jflamy
See Also:

Constructor Detail

BeanTupleQueryView

public BeanTupleQueryView(BeanTupleQueryDefinition queryDefinition,
                          BeanTupleQueryFactory queryFactory)
Constructs LazyQueryView with given QueryDefinition and QueryFactory. BeanTupleQueryView delegates as much as it can to a wrapped LazyQueryView, hence the need to conform to the constructor of the underlying implementation.

Parameters:
queryDefinition - The QueryDefinition to be used (will be injected in queryFactory)
queryFactory - The QueryFactory to be used.
Method Detail

the query factory that creates the views.

setKeyPropertyId

public void setKeyPropertyId(Object keyPropertyId)
If not null, use the property from the container as itemId If null, use the integer index from the underlying LazyQueryContainer

Parameters:
keyPropertyId - the keyPropertyId to set

getItem

public com.vaadin.data.Item getItem(Object id)
Retrieve an item from the container.

If retrieving by key (i.e. setKeyPropertyId() has been called), the item must have been previously loaded.

If an int is used as key, then we fallback to the LazyQueryContainer behavior for filling up the cache.

.

Parameters:
id - which item to retrieve
Returns:
the item, if found, or null if not.
